author: Steven Klusman

review: If you own Apple products, you need to get this. It has the simplicity, reliability and clean interface of a typical Apple product. I wish I would have gotten this years ago. I read all the reviews particularly the ones comparing them to Roku III. but in retrospect, it was a wasted effort. Apple users prefer intuitive simple to use features with a clean interface. That's what this provides. I'm not a gamer. I'm not someone who can't afford to pay for items and needs to jail break an item to get free apps. I'm too busy to watch or need 1000 apps/stations/channels whatever you want to call it.  Yeah, the Apple TV doesn't have as many apps as the Roku but it has the only apps that you will really need. What you want is what I wanted. You want a device that won't lose connection. You want something that is easy to use. You want a clean interface. You want to be able to import your iTunes so you can play music over your television for when you have guests over or just provide a nice ambience in the home. You want to be able to view your photos and videos on your television.  This product does not deserve less than 5 stars.
author: Sam

review: This is an awesome and easy to use product. We have Netflix and hardly ever watch regular cable any more. I especially love the 'just for kids' section on Netflix. We now have a huge library of kids movies to choose from. There is tons of other features but that's all we have really used and it has been a great source of entertainment. I ended up buying an extra set of the cables so we can easily move it from the living room to the bed room.
